intro: Quesnelia quesneliana, commonly known as the Queñel tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a central water-holding basin. The plant produces striking inflorescences with brightly colored flowers, often in shades of red, orange, and yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
